meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel distressed or discouraged.
meanings.sent1: The loud thunderstorm may dismay my dog.
meanings.sent2: The bad news can dismay people.
meanings.sent3: The cat's refusal to eat the new food may dismay its owner.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected test results dismayed the students.
meanings.sent5: The broken toy dismayed the child.

meanings.definition: A sudden feeling of distress or alarm.
meanings.sent1: Her face showed dismay when she saw the mess.
meanings.sent2: The sudden noise caused dismay among the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The dismay on his face was quickly replaced by a smile.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds brought a sense of dismay to the picnic.
meanings.sent5: The lost keys caused great dismay for the forgetful man.
